title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 1. These are the Avian Influenza (Precautionary Confinement of Birds and
text_raw:
1. These are the Avian Influenza (Precautionary Confinement of Birds and 
Restriction on Assembly of Live Birds) Regulations 2025 and come into 
operation on 17th February 2025.
text_norm: 1 avian influenza (precautionary confinement bird restriction assembly live birds) regulation 2025 come operation 17th february 2025

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: In these Regulations:
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations: 

“direction” means a direction under Regulation 4; 

“poultry” means birds kept in captivity for the production of meat or eggs for 
consumption, the production of other products, for restocking supplies of game 
birds or for the purposes of breeding for the production of these categories of 
birds; 

“other captive bird” means a bird other than poultry that is kept in captivity; 

“secure building” means a building where poultry or other captive birds are 
confined in a manner that they cannot come into contact with wild birds and 
other birds cannot come into contact with birds confined to the building.
text_norm: 2 regulation direction mean direction regulation 4 poultry mean bird kept captivity production meat egg consumption production product restocking supply game bird purpose breeding production category bird captive bird mean bird poultry kept captivity secure building mean building poultry captive bird confined manner cannot come contact wild bird bird cannot come contact bird confined building

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 3. (1) A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her
text_raw:
3. (1) A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her 
possession or under his or her control shall take all reasonable steps to confine 
such poultry or captive birds – 

(a) 

in a secure building in accordance with the biosecurity measures 
set out in the Schedule, or 

(b) where it is not possible to confine poultry or other captive birds 
within a secure building, to confine them in a manner that they do 
not have access to other poultry, other captive birds or wild birds, 
in accordance with the biosecurity measures in the Schedule. 

(2) A person who has birds referred to in paragraph (1) in his or her 
possession or under his or her control shall take all necessary steps to ensure that 
the birds do not come into contact with other birds.
text_norm: 3 (1) person poultry captive bird possession control shall take reasonable step confine poultry captive bird - (a) secure building accordance biosecurity measure set schedule (b) possible confine poultry captive bird within secure building confine manner access poultry captive bird wild bird accordance biosecurity measure schedule (2) person bird referred paragraph (1) possession control shall take necessary step ensure bird come contact bird

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 4. (1) It is sufficient compliance with Regulation 3 (1) if birds referred to in
text_raw:
4. (1) It is sufficient compliance with Regulation 3 (1) if birds referred to in 

that provision are confined in accordance with a direction. 

(2) A direction shall be in legible form or, if in non-legible form, capable of 
being reproduced in legible form and may be varied or revoked by further 
direction. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 18th February, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [31] 3 

(3) An authorised officer may issue a direction, attach conditions to a 
direction, vary a condition, insert a new condition, revoke a direction or refuse 
an application. 

(4) An authorised officer shall not issue a direction unless the officer is 
satisfied that all necessary precautions are, and will remain, in operation to 
prevent the risk of an outbreak of avian influenza. 

(5) Notwithstanding the generality of paragraph (3), a condition to a 

direction may include provisions relating to- 

(a) 

the confinement of birds, 

(b) 

the supply of feed and water to birds confined to a premises, 

(c) 

biosecurity, including disinfection procedures, and measures to 
prevent transfer of contamination, 

(d) 

control of vermin, and 

(e) 

the movement of persons, vehicles and equipment. 

(6) A person to whom a direction is given shall comply with the direction. 

(7) If an authorised officer revokes a direction, he or she shall- 

(a) 

notify the person concerned in writing of the decision and the 
reasons for the decision, and that he or she may make 
representations to the Minister in relation to the decision within 7 
days of the date of the notification, 

(b) 

consider a representation duly made, and 

(c) 

confirm, modify or annul the decision and notify the person 
concerned of the decision and the reasons for the decision.

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 5. A person shall not –
text_raw:
5. A person shall not – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

organise or take part in an event which involves assembling birds, 

sell or supply a live bird at a fair, market, mart or other gathering, 
or 

have a live bird in his or her possession or under his and her 
control at an event to which paragraph (1) or (2) relates.

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 1. All necessary measures to reduce the movement of people, vehicles or
text_raw:
1. All necessary measures to reduce the movement of people, vehicles or 
equipment to and from areas where poultry or other captive birds are 
kept.
text_norm: 1 necessary measure reduce movement people vehicle equipment area poultry captive bird kept

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 2. All necessary measures to minimise the risk that poultry or other captive
text_raw:
2. All necessary measures to minimise the risk that poultry or other captive 
birds will become affected with avian influenza through exposure to 
manure, slurry or other products.
text_norm: 2 necessary measure minimise risk poultry captive bird become affected avian influenza exposure manure slurry product

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: Effective vermin control, including preventing the entry of wild and
text_raw:
4. 

Effective vermin control, including preventing the entry of wild and 
domestic animals to land or premises where poultry or other captive 
birds are kept. 

Feed and bedding must be stored in such a manner that other animals, 
including wild birds, do not have access.
text_norm: 4 effective vermin control including preventing entry wild domestic animal land premise poultry captive bird kept feed bedding must stored manner animal including wild bird access

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 5. A person who has contact with poultry or other captive birds must take
text_raw:
5. A person who has contact with poultry or other captive birds must take 
all reasonable measures to avoid the transfer of avian influenza virus to 
or from land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept, 
including cleansing and disinfection of equipment, vehicles and 
footwear that has been in contact with poultry or other captive birds.
text_norm: 5 person contact poultry captive bird must take reasonable measure avoid transfer avian influenza virus land premise poultry captive bird kept including cleansing disinfection equipment vehicle footwear contact poultry captive bird

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: Provide at all entry and exit points of land or premises where poultry or
text_raw:
6. 

Provide at all entry and exit points of land or premises where poultry or 
other captive birds are kept, disinfection points containing sufficient 
amount of a disinfectant that is effective against avian influenza virus 
used in accordance with the manufacturer’s guidelines.
text_norm: 6 provide entry exit point land premise poultry captive bird kept disinfection point containing sufficient amount disinfectant effective avian influenza virus used accordance manufacturer guideline

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 7. All necessary measures must be taken to prevent access by wild birds
text_raw:
7. All necessary measures must be taken to prevent access by wild birds 
to land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept.
text_norm: 7 necessary measure must taken prevent access wild bird land premise poultry captive bird kept

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: Provide feed and water to poultry or other captive birds in such a way
text_raw:
9. 

Provide feed and water to poultry or other captive birds in such a way 
that is not accessible to wild birds. 

Take all necessary measures to prevent overgrowth of vegetation or 
accumulation of uncovered water on the land or premises.
text_norm: 9 provide feed water poultry captive bird way accessible wild bird take necessary measure prevent overgrowth vegetation accumulation uncovered water land premise

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 10. Remove from land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are
text_raw:
10. Remove from land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are 
kept anything that might attract wild birds from the premises such as 
fallen fruit or uneaten feed.
text_norm: 10 remove land premise poultry captive bird kept anything might attract wild bird premise fallen fruit uneaten feed

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 11. Take all necessary measures to thoroughly clean and disinfect buildings
text_raw:
11. Take all necessary measures to thoroughly clean and disinfect buildings 
and equipment at the end of each production cycle, using a disinfectant 
the right 
that 
concentration. 

is effective against avian 

influenza viruses at
text_norm: 11 take necessary measure thoroughly clean disinfect building equipment end production cycle using disinfectant right concentration effective avian influenza virus

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: In respect of poultry or other captive birds referred to in Regulation 3
text_raw:
12. 

In respect of poultry or other captive birds referred to in Regulation 3 
(1) (b), an outdoor area to which poultry and other captive birds have 
access must be fenced to confine the birds and must be actively 
managed to ensure- 

(a) 

the area is not contaminated with feathers or faecal material from 
wild birds and all reasonable steps are taken to remove such 
contamination, if present, 

 
 [31] 5 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

(j) 

the area is fenced to keep the poultry or other captive birds 
confined within the area and to prevent wild birds from having 
access to the area, 

access to open or permanent standing water is restricted by 
fencing-off and netting ponds, standing water or waterlogged 
land, 

feed and water and bedding must be stored indoors, in such a 
manner that they are not accessible to other animals, including 
wild birds, 

poultry and other captive birds are fed indoors or under a covered 
area in a manner that the feed and water is not accessible to wild 
birds, 

appropriate usen is made of devices such as streamers, bird 
scarers or foils to discourage wild birds. 

carcasses are removed immediately from the area, 

regular cleansing and disinfection are carried out on all concrete 
walkways, paths and similar surfaces to which poultry or other 
captive birds have access, 

there is regular inspection of the area, and 

all necessary measures are taken to prevent overgrowth of 
vegetation or accumulation of uncovered water on the land.

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 13. Captive raptors (birds of prey) may be exercised outdoors provided
text_raw:
13. Captive raptors (birds of prey) may be exercised outdoors provided 

contact with wild birds is avoided. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for 
Agriculture, Food and the Marine, 

14 February, 2025. 

MICHEAL SHEAHAN, 

An officer authorised to authenticate the official Seal of 
the Minister.

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations provide for the housing of domestic poultry and captive birds 
and the restriction on assembly of live birds as precautionary measures against 
risk of avian influenza. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [31] 7
